zone.line: The anatomies of unknown winged things,
isles
And fishes which were islands of living scale,
And serpents, bony chains, twisted around
within
The iron crags, or around heaps of dust
To which the tortuous strength of thier last
Had crushed the iron crags;--& over these
The jagged alligator & the might
Of earth-convulsing behemoth, which once
Were monarch beasts, & on the slimy shores
And weed-overgrown continents of Earth
Increased & multiplied like summer worms
On an abandoned corpse, till the blue globe
Wrapt Deluge round it like a cloak, & they
Gasped, Yelled, gaspt & were abolished; [or] some God
Whose throne was in a Comet, past, & cried--
Be not! -- & like my words they were no
The Earth madness
The joy, the triumph, the delight, the gladness!
The boundless, overflowing bursting gladness
The vapourous exultation, not to be confined!
Ha! ha! the Animation of delight
